coolestThingLearned.question: What's the coolest thing you learned in Tron?
responses: How things work - gain such an appreciation for technology and the advancements made in all of engineering over the last 50ish years
PID controller
Multivariable Calculus
How to do everything
IOP programming for control systems
Solidworks
How to build fuckin robots
Laplace transforms
Opamps can do math thats crazy thats why they're called operational
How to make a cool robot do something you want it to do (controls)
Engineering Econ was actually hella cool
Feedback loops are super cool! There are a lot of applications starting from a simple thermometer all the way to the robotics, aerospace, and manufacturing industries

mostProudOf.question: What are you most proud of in your experience in Tron?
responses: Surviving, making a functional capstone
Capstone
My capstone team and what we were able to make
how to make PCBs
Fastest 3YDP car
Capstone design
Not failing any courses
Making it to the end!
How it has left me feeling like a capable and componenet engineer when in the beginning I had so many doubts
My capstone project
Winning the stupid 380 competition
Pulling together FYDP

Presenting our capstone project at symposium was a big moment, capping off our journey by completing such a big project was a very proud moment, and seeing others be interested in our project and impact. Walking around symposium and seeing all the other impressive projects also made me really proud to be a part of this cohort alongside so many talented classmates who I'm sure will go on to do great things.
decided to completely 180 my field of work from SW to HW
Capstone Project - the most amount of awards I got within the year!

favouriteMemory.question: What is your favourite memory from your time at UW?
responses: Bro there are too many
All of 4th year - Tron breakfast, parties, birthdays, the list goes on
Spending the summer hanging out with friends
making quinzee at tron snowball fight
All the engineering projects
Watching my friends take out all the rubber stars from the glass storage area in between E7 and E5
Time spent with friends
Slamming beers at BOATs races
Working with my friends on the FSAE design team at 3am solving cool problems while half drunk
trip to Bruce Peninsula National Park
Just chilling with the Tron family at our place! Cooking dishes, playing Mario Kart, and talking about why BC is superior to Alberta

biggestRegret.question: What is one regret you have after finishing university?
responses: Not doing more engsoc activities
Not having enough fun
Not appreciating how fast everything is going to go by
Not spending more time socializing more clubs/social activities
Not joining enough non-engineering clubs
didn't spend enough time on clubs and design teams
Not exploring the city and campus enough
Not switching out of tron in 2A
I probably should've tried harder. Got discouraged during the Covid years and might have had more opportunities had I done more studying and practice problems.
Not joining more sports leagues or clubs
Do more clubs and things earlier on (that you actually enjoy)!
Should've talked to more people
Should have spent more time in the machine shop when it was easy
Doing more events earlier on in school and taking on more design team work and putting in more effort into that instead of school.
going to Kanata, Ontario
I should have participated in more Hackathons

nicestThing.question: What is the nicest thing someone at UW did for you?
responses: Driven me/picked me up from the hospital
Gave me a PR spot on the Ultimate B team my rookie year
be friends :)
Take care of me when I fainted
graduate me :P
Ran to my apartment to get my calculator for my exam
Go on walks with me when I was feeling down
Did 100% of a lab worth 20% while I was concussed
Gave me problem set answers 1 hour before they were due <3
Prof let me take the exam with extra time after I was 2hrs late to a 2.5hr exam

I thought someone had stolen my fancy headphones because I couldn't find them for weeks, then I got an email from Les in the E5 machine shop that he foudn them and tried to pair with them and saw my name
shoutout Midogoha let me shower at his place for a week when my water heating shut down
They asked me if everything was okay when it was not, that is the consolation I needed to continue moving forward.

inspirationalQuotes.question: What is your favourite inspirational quote/words to live by?
responses: Life is all about building dad lore
if bruteforce doesn't work, you didn't use enough of it
it is easier to ask for forgiveness than it is for permission
It ain't how many times you get knocked down, it's how many times you get back up
A champion is not defined by their wins, but by how they can recover when they fall - Serena Williams
If you knew it would all work out in the end, would you enjoy yourself more along the way?
If it ain't broke don't fix it. Power is an illusion of perception
if it works it works
You are all the things that are wrong with you
It is what it is

Am I clear?

is it clear

Is it clear?

lifeHacks.question: What is the best life hack/tip?
responses: Try your hardest to rent in a house rather than apartment - vibes are unmatched
finish things early
10 lines at lazeez to start your day
Perfection is almost never worth it!!! It takes the same amount of energy to go from 0% to 80% as it does to go from 80% to 100%. Prioritize ur life!
Nobody has any idea what they're doing so you might as well just try to do whatever
put yourself out there, there's no shame in failing if you gave it your all
Just grind out work in advance whenever you're free regardless if you have the time.
Cook a lot than just one serving, so you can store leftovers and eat it over time

responses.response: I hope to be able to achieve a better understanding of cutting edge technology
Find a job and take care of myself
Well-roundedness
Get a job
Finally get some sleep :) ... probably won't happen.
work on good projects and build my full time resume
Get my masters, get a good job after graduating from my masters, continue my romantic relationship

Cement myself well within company and become the influence I want to be within the company - including improved workflows (away from paper systems) and display my mechanical design prowess with novel ideas for this small company. Achieve a work life balance and go to the gym/settle into a good routine and finish furnishing my appartment.
Stability
professionally: make moneys, personally: learn to make a swiss roll

Find a job, go to a Ren Fair

Money

Not get burnt out

Using my learnings and platform to inspire others and work in the Motorsport industry

insights: Job acquisition is the most common immediate concern
Work-life balance is increasingly important to new graduates
Health and wellness often neglected during school, prioritized post-graduation
Many responses show humor/levity about serious topics
Wide range from basic survival needs to ambitious career goals
Personal relationships and social connections important
Some graduates already employed, focused on advancement
